item.title: Ex-officials say Gaza policy has put US at risk
item.description: A joint statement by 12 former officials says US policy on Gaza has "put a target on America’s back".

item.title: "Almost Fell Asleep": Biden Reacts To Debate Debacle Against Trump
item.description: US President Joe Biden today blamed international travel and jet lag for his debate debacle against his Republican rival Donald Trump.

item.title: UK Labour Party To Outdo 1997 Landslide Victory This Time, Poll Predicts
item.description: The UK Labour Party is 99 per cent "certain" to secure more seats in Thursday's general election than when it won a landslide victory in 1997, a major new poll said on Tuesday.

item.title: US Supreme Court Agrees To Review Age Verification Law For Online Porn
item.description: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear a challenge to a law in Republican-led Texas that requires pornographic websites to verify the age of visitors in order to limit minors' access to online sexual content.

item.title: Boris Johnson makes surprise late move to avert Tory wipeout
item.description: Boris Johnson made a surprise appearance on Tuesday night to urge Conservative voters to prevent Labour from achieving a landslide victory in the upcoming UK general election. In an unscheduled speech in central London, Johnson, who is not running as a Tory candidate, warned that a Labour government with a significant majority would undo Conservative achievements.

item.title: China is building and testing lethal attack drones for Russia
item.description: Chinese and Russian companies are reportedly developing an attack drone similar to Iran's Shahed model, which has been used in Ukraine, according to European officials. This collaboration began in 2023 and has progressed to development and testing stages, with the intention of shipping the drones to Russia. The Chinese drones have not yet been deployed in Ukraine.

item.title: Russia's Novorossiysk authorities limit beach access after sea drones attacks
item.description: Russia has often accused Ukraine of attacking its port cities on the Black Sea coast and on the Moscow-annexed Crimean Peninsula, but Russian officials often do not disclose the full extent of damage inflicted by Ukrainian attacks.

item.title: Malaysia court dismisses jailed ex-PM Najib's bid to serve sentence under house arrest
item.description: Former PM Najib Razak's bid for house arrest denied by Malaysian court, pushing for execution of royal order in 1MDB scandal case.

item.title: US expels more than 100 Chinese migrants in rare mass deportation
item.description:
Department of Homeland Security says it plans more such ‘large charter flights’, sparking concerns for safety of migrants escaping poverty or repression

The US has sent back 116 Chinese migrants in the first such “large charter flight” in five years, the Department of Homeland Security has said.

“We will continue to enforce our immigration laws and remove individuals without a legal basis to remain in the United States,” homeland security secretary Alejandro Mayorkas said in a statement.

Continue reading...

Hunter Biden sues Fox News over explicit images featured in a streaming series
